token.tokenWillExpireOnAt: The token will expire on {{date}} at {{time}}}.
token.validateTokenRevoke: Are you sure you want to revoke this token?
token.validateTokenRevokeDescription: Anyone using this token will no longer be able to access the DataHub API. You cannot undo this action.
token.manageAccessTokenForUseWithAPI: Manage Access Tokens for use with DataHub APIs.
token.basedAuthIsDisabled: Token based authentication is currently disabled. Contact your DataHub administrator to enable this feature.
token.personalAccessTokenDescription: Personal Access Tokens allow you to make programmatic requests to DataHub's APIs. They inherit your privileges and have a finite lifespan. Do not share Personal Access Tokens.
token.makeSureYouCopyYourAccessToken: Make sure to copy your personal access token now. You wonâ€™t be able to see it again.
token.learnMoreLink_html: To learn more about the DataHub APIs, check out the DataHub Docs.
token.toUseATokenExplanation_component: To use the token, provide it as a <typographyText keyboard>Bearer</typographyText> token in the <typographyText keyboard>Authorization</typographyText> header when making API requests:

permissions.areYouSureRemovePolicy: Are you sure you want to remove policy?
permissions.policyAppliesToGroupsDescription: Search for specific groups that this policy should apply to, or select `All Groups` to apply it to all groups.
permissions.managePermissionsDescription: View your DataHub permissions. Take administrative actions.
permissions.nameForNewPolicy: A name for your new policy.
permissions.typeOfPolicyToCreate: The type of policy you would like to create.
permissions.typeOfPolicyDescription_html:
The Platform policy type allows you to assign top-level DataHub Platform privileges to users.These include managing users and groups, creating policies, viewing analytics dashboards and more.

The Metadata policy type allows you to assign metadata privileges to users. These include the ability to manipulate metadata like ownership, tags, documentation associated with Datasets, Charts, Dashboards, & more.
permissions.newPolicyDescription: An optional description for your new policy.
permissions.resourceTypeDescription: Select the types of resources this policy should apply to. If none is selected, policy is applied to all types of resources.
permissions.resourceTypeDescriptionPlaceHolder: Apply to ALL resource types by default. Select types to apply to specific types of entities.
permissions.resourceDescription: Search for specific resources the policy should apply to. If none is selected, policy is applied to all resources of the given type.
permissions.resourceDescriptionPlaceHolder: Apply to ALL resources by default. Select specific resources to apply to.
permissions.domainDescription: Search for domains the policy should apply to. If none is selected, policy is applied to all resources in all domains.
permissions.domainDescriptionPlaceHolder: Apply to ALL domains by default. Select domains to apply to specific domains.
permissions.privilegesLabel: Select a set of privileges to permit.
permissions.policyAppliesToLabel: Select the users & groups that this policy should apply to.
permissions.policyAppliesToDescription: Whether this policy should be apply to owners of the Metadata asset. If true, those who are marked as owners of a Metadata Asset, either directly or indirectly via a Group, will have the selected privileges.
permissions.policyAppliesToUserDescription: Search for specific users that this policy should apply to, or select `All Users` to apply it to all users.
permissions.exitPolicyEditorContent: Are you sure you want to exit policy editor? All changes will be lost
